alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Tarrant (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 22 at 1:30AM CDT until August 22 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR JOHNSON AND SOUTH CENTRAL TARRANT COUNTIES... At 130 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms continuing to produce heavy rain across Johnson County and far southern Tarrant County with several reports of flash flooding. Interstate 35W was reportedly closed in Alvarado due to flooding of the roadway. Flash flooding will continue across the area for another couple of hours. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fort Worth, Mansfield, Burleson, Cleburne, Crowley, Keene, Joshua, Alvarado, Rendon, Venus, Grandview, Cross Timber, Rio Vista and Briaroaks. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
